Duong.  Go Dau district police, Tay Ninh province,
said they had just coordinated with Ha Tinh province police
to arrest Mai Van Dong,
born in 1992, residing in Bac Giang province, to
investigate and clarify the illegal buying and selling of weapons by
Go district police.  Although it was discovered that
Dong was selling military guns as
well as many other guns at prices ranging from
5 to 10 million VND per gun, he
traded goods through the express delivery system
during the investigation process by
Go district police.  Dau received information from
Ha Tinh province police investigating a
nationwide illegal weapons trading ring
including Mai Van Dong, then the
two provinces' police forces coordinated to arrest him
when he arrived at the Phuoc commune post office.  Dong
sent the goods through police inspection and discovered
inside the package was a roller gun body
and two bullets. The
police confiscated seven additional roller guns and
14 other roller guns as
unassembled components.  One K54 gun,
two sports guns, one
tear gas gun, three bullet packs, two mobile phones
and a number of related documents.
Go Dau district police handed over the
crowd and their belongings to the police.

according to

Ninh district police are criminally detaining three subjects
between the ages of 17 and 19 living in
the same area to investigate and clarify the act of murder.
While drinking, Vo
Huynh Minh Khoa, 17 years old, told Nguyen Vo
Giang Son, 19 years old, and Nguyen Tuan Khanh,
18 years old, about Dat texting
his girlfriend to go out. Then the group discussed going
to Dat's house to pay.  Son's enemy
called a subject to borrow a weapon
including two forks and a machete and then
went to Dat's house in Duong Minh Chau district
to where Khanh sat outside. Khoa and Son went
inside the paint and used their feet to kick Dat's person when they
saw Dat.  While sleeping, they
attacked the victim, holding a three-forked knife
and stabbing him while Son held a machete and slashing at him.
Dat suffered multiple injuries. His family took him to the
emergency room at the hospital. Upon receiving the news,
Duong Minh district police force was informed.  Chau

at about 3:30 p.m.  Early this morning, at a

to

at the Postpartum Hospital of
Khanh Hoa Provincial General Hospital.  There was initial information
sent to the
press, according to which the pregnant woman was admitted to the hospital on the morning of
October 8 with pre-
labor diagnosis and was assigned to give birth naturally on
January 10. She gave birth to a baby boy weighing 3.2 kg.
However,
about 4 hours later, the pregnant woman bled out
and was monitored for postpartum hemorrhage and
then transferred to emergency surgery due to
very severe bleeding during
hemostasis surgery. The mother went into cardiac arrest twice.
The hospital has focused maximum
human resources and resources on treatment. But because the
illness was so severe, it progressed so quickly that at
10:30 p.m. on January 10, the pregnant woman
died immediately after the incident. The
hospital had a follow-up meeting.  contact with
the family and will soon have an accurate answer
forwarded to agencies and the
pregnant woman's family.
